tn.ref: He did what was right in the eyes of Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:14:01|14:2]]

tn.ref: did not turn away either to the right or to the left
tn.text: AT: "did not hesitate to obey God in any way whatsoever," or "he obeyed all of God's commands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
AT: "until they were very small pieces that could be carried away by the wind"
AT: "were completely destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] )
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
"gave to him the responsibility of using the money"
AT: "allowed to rot"
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]

tn.ref: These Levites were in charge of those who carried building material and all other men who worked in any way
tn.text: AT: "These Levites were in charge of all of the men who did any kind of building work."
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]

tn.ref: When they brought out the money that was brought into the house of Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "When the supervisors were receiving the money in the temple,"

tn.ref: everything that has been entrusted to them
tn.text: AT: "everything that you gave them the responsibility to do."
AT: "They have gathered"
this phrase is a marker; it indicates that what follows is an especially important event in this story. AT: "Now, notice what happens next:"
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
AT: "Ask Yahweh what he wants me to do"

tn.ref: because of the words of the book
tn.text: AT: "according to what is written in the book"

tn.ref: For it is great, the anger of Yahweh that has been poured out on us. It is great
tn.text: Emotions such as anger are often spoken of in Scripture as if they were liquids. AT: "For Yahweh's anger towards us is great, like water that could totally wash us away." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
AT: "who took care of the priestly robes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: they spoke with her in this way
tn.text: AT: "they had the following conversation with her"

tn.ref: so that they might provoke me to anger with all the deeds they have committed
tn.text: "the result is that they have made me extremely angry because of what they have done"
"make me angry"

tn.ref: therefore my anger will be poured out on this place, and it will not be extinguished
tn.text: Emotions such as anger are often spoken of in Scripture as if they were liquids. AT: "therefore it will be like a fire that I pour out on them, and nothing will stop this fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh, the God of Israel says this: About the words that you heard, because your heart was tender
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh, the God of Israel says this about the words that you have heard, because your heart was soft - willing to change" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] )
This was a sign of sorrow and repentance.

tn.ref: I will gather you to your ancestors. You will be gathered to your grave
tn.text: AT: "you will die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
AT: "you will not experience" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: all the people, from great to small
tn.text: AT: "everyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
AT: "read to them"
AT: "stood where he was supposed to stand at the entrance to the temple"

tn.ref: with all his heart and all his soul
tn.text: Together, these two phrases form an idiomatic expression that refers to a person's entire being. AT: "with all his being" or "wholeheartedly." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: all who were found in Jerusalem and Benjamin
tn.text: AT: "all who lived in Jerusalem and Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
AT: "to obey the covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These are the idols that were repulsive to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
